data.title: Renpy Game brings the Windowmanager to crash
data.body:
The Renpy Game Loren the Amazon Princess, won't work in Fullscreen on Kubuntu 14.10. It just kills the Windowmanager several Times. Here is the Crash Report, if it helps to fix the problem.

Application: kwin_x11 (5.1.0)
 (Compiled from sources)
Qt Version: 5.3.0
Operating System: Linux 3.16.0-24-generic x86_64
Distribution: Ubuntu 14.10

-- Information about the crash:
- What I was doing when the application crashed: 
  I was trying to play a Game on Steam, which uses Ren'py Framework. Loren the Amazon.
- Unusual behavior I noticed:
  It crashes multiple times. And with every Start of the Game.
- Custom settings of the application: 
  None.

The crash can be reproduced every time.

-- Backtrace:
Application: KWin (kwin_x11), signal: Segmentation fault
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".

data.title: Crash on Mac OS X with OpenGL renderer and gl_resize enabled in windowed mode
data.body:
Let's say I have a non standard Mac but rather custom. That said the driver used with graphics card is official delivered by Apple and so far I have had no other problems even in heavy 3D games. But more recent Ren'Py games published on Steam crash right after intro sequence without leaving anything in logs or any meaningful error message. By trial and error I found that the problem is in OpenGL renderer, but if it is turned off these games start to look [like this](https://imgur.com/0dZZKu6). I continued my search and found that disabling `gl_resize` setting while OpenGL is enabled solves my problem. Next I tried to change modes and resolution and found that games crash only on some resolutions and never in fullscreen.

When they crash:
[**Sunrider log.txt**](https://gist.github.com/subcake/91e0e4a3a6ec35c60f2c) (Ren'Py 6.18.1.670)
[**Shan Gui log.txt**](https://gist.github.com/subcake/2326ad747a87b80f54bf) (Ren'Py 6.18.2.729)

When they don't (Dock is hidden, no other changes):
[**Sunrider log.txt**](https://gist.github.com/subcake/c06c9e9c2d33709ed894) (Ren'Py 6.18.1.670)
[**Shan Gui log.txt**](https://gist.github.com/subcake/ea9eb10327a93cd1a8fc) (Ren'Py 6.18.2.729)

Mac OS X 10.10 (Yosemite)

data.title: Occasional visual artifacts scaling Frame()s in OpenGL
data.body:
I'm seeing occasional glitches where the corners of a Frame are rendered at a slightly different size than the body at some window sizes.  Screenshots:

Number of texture units: 8
Using shader environment.
Using copy RTT.
Using gl renderer.
Texture testing:
- Hardware max texture size: 4096
- 64px textures work.
- 128px textures work.
- 256px textures work.
- 512px textures work.
- 1024px textures work.
- 2048px textures work.
  Performance test:
- Target is 5 frames in 0.333333333333 seconds.
- Frame drawn at 0.000000 seconds.
- Frame drawn at 0.171523 seconds.
- Frame drawn at 0.187502 seconds.
- Frame drawn at 0.202100 seconds.
- Frame drawn at 0.216637 seconds.
- 0.216637 seconds to render 5 frames.

data.title: Problem with events when composing transforms.
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=28347#p343556

data.title: self-voicing has problems with {w} and {p} text tags
data.body:
Try:

```
e "You've created...{w} a new Ren'Py game." #1
e "Once you add a story, pictures, and music...,{p} you can release it to the world!" #2
e "You've created...{w=3.0} a new Ren'Py game." #3
e "Once you add a story, pictures, and music...,{p=6.0} you can release it to the world!" #4
```

Numbers 1-2: the voice ignores the tags and reads all the line.
Numbers 3-4: first the voice ignores the tags and, when the time is over, reads it again.

data.title: Traditional Chinese translation for launcher updated.
data.body: Traditional Chinese translation for launcher updated.

data.title: Add a way to check for available updates.
data.body:
This should run in a background thread, so as not to block the game. It should:
- Attempt to run at most once per day.
- Be available through a function. 
- Restart the interaction when the state changes.
- Integrate with updater.Update's sensitive state.

data.title: transform doesn't work by show layer
data.body:
I written below code.
    label start:
        scene bg black
        show t0 A:
            xalign 0
            yalign 0
        with dissolve
        "2"
        show layer master:
            ease .5 zoom 2
        "1"
        show layer master:
            ease .5 zoom 1
First, t0 A zoomed to 2.0 smoothly. But second, the image zoomed to 1.0 immediately.

data.title: While at the main menu, predict the start label
button isn't work in side
data.body:
I made below screen but button didn't work if the bar was clicked.
Please watch movie https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=taHNSOyf_G0&feature=youtu.be

I think this may be performance issue.

```
screen test():
    $ adj = ui.adjustment(value=test_value, changed=test_changed, range=1, step=1, page=1) #, changed = readback_change_page, step = 1, page=1, range=readback_paged_max())
    frame:
        yfill True
        side "c r":
            yfill True
            vbox:
                for line in test_buffer[test_value]:
                    textbutton line[1] action Quit()
            bar adjustment adj style 'vscrollbar'
init python:
    test_buffer = [
        [
        (None, "　私がウスウスと眼を覚ました時、こうした蜜蜂（みつばち）の唸（うな）るような音は、まだ、その弾力の深い余韻を、私の耳の穴の中にハッキリと引き残していた。", None), 
        (None, "　それをジッと聞いているうちに……今は真夜中だな……と直覚した。そうしてどこか近くでボンボン時計が鳴っているんだな……と思い思い、又もウトウトしているうちに、その蜜蜂のうなりのような余韻は、いつとなく次々に消え薄れて行って、そこいら中がヒッソリと静まり返ってしまった。", None), 
        (None, "　私はフッと眼を開いた。", None), 
        (None, "　かなり高い、白ペンキ塗の天井裏から、薄白い塵埃（ほこり）に蔽（おお）われた裸の電球がタッタ一つブラ下がっている。その赤黄色く光る硝子球（ガラスだま）の横腹に、大きな蠅（はえ）が一匹とまっていて、死んだように凝然（じっ）としている。その真下の固い、冷めたい人造石の床の上に、私は大の字型（なり）に長くなって寝ているようである。", None), 
        (None, "　……おかしいな…………。", None), 
        (None, "　私は大の字型（なり）に凝然（じっ）としたまま、瞼（まぶた）を一パイに見開いた。そうして眼の球（たま）だけをグルリグルリと上下左右に廻転さしてみた。", None), 
        (None, "　青黒い混凝土（コンクリート）の壁で囲まれた二間（けん）四方ばかりの部屋である。", None), 
        (None, "　その三方の壁に、黒い鉄格子と、鉄網（かなあみ）で二重に張り詰めた、大きな縦長い磨硝子（すりガラス）の窓が一つ宛（ずつ）、都合三つ取付けられている、トテも要心（ようじん）堅固に構えた部屋の感じである。", None)
        ], 
        [
        (None, "　窓の無い側の壁の附け根には、やはり岩乗（がんじょう）な鉄の寝台が一個、入口の方向を枕にして横たえてあるが、その上の真白な寝具が、キチンと敷き展（なら）べたままになっているところを見ると、まだ誰も寝たことがないらしい。", None), 
        (None, "　……おかしいぞ…………。", None), 
        (None, "　私は少し頭を持ち上げて、自分の身体（からだ）を見廻わしてみた。", None), 
        (None, "　白い、新しいゴワゴワした木綿の着物が二枚重ねて着せてあって、短かいガーゼの帯が一本、胸高に結んである。そこから丸々と肥（ふと）って突き出ている四本の手足は、全体にドス黒く、垢だらけになっている……そのキタナラシサ……。", None), 
        (None, "　……いよいよおかしい……。", None), 
        (None, "　怖（こ）わ怖（ご）わ右手（めて）をあげて、自分の顔を撫（な）でまわしてみた。", None), 
        (None, "　……鼻が尖（と）んがって……眼が落ち窪（くぼ）んで……頭髪（あたま）が蓬々（ぼうぼう）と乱れて……顎鬚（あごひげ）がモジャモジャと延びて……。", None), 
        (None, "　……私はガバと跳ね起きた。", None), 
        (None, "　モウ一度、顔を撫でまわしてみた。", None), 
        (None, "　そこいらをキョロキョロと見廻わした。", None), 
        (None, "　……誰だろう……俺はコンナ人間を知らない……。", None), 
        (None, "　胸の動悸がみるみる高まった。早鐘を撞（つ）くように乱れ撃ち初めた……呼吸が、それに連れて荒くなった。やがて死ぬかと思うほど喘（あえ）ぎ出した。……かと思うと又、ヒッソリと静まって来た。", None), 
        (None, "　……こんな不思議なことがあろうか……。", None)
        ]
    ]
    test_value=1
    def test_changed(change):
        global test_value
        test_value = int(change)
        renpy.restart_interaction()


label start:

    scene bg black
    show screen test
    pause

    return
```

data.title: The side "c" which has more than two buttons can't be shown
data.body:
If the center has one button, screen is show correctly.

```
screen test():
    $ adj = ui.adjustment(value=test_value, changed=test_changed, range=10, step=1, page=1)
    frame:
        yfill True
        side "c r":
            yfill True
            textbutton "test"+str(test_changed) action Quit() ####### <-
            bar adjustment adj style 'vscrollbar'
init python:
    test_value=1
    def test_changed(change):
        global test_value
        test_value = int(change)
        renpy.restart_interaction()

label start:
    show screen test
    pause
```

But if the center has more than two buttons like below

```
screen test():
    $ adj = ui.adjustment(value=test_value, changed=test_changed, range=10, step=1, page=1)
    frame:
        yfill True
        side "c r":
            yfill True
            textbutton "test"+str(test_changed) action Quit() ######## <-
            textbutton "test"+str(test_changed) action Quit() ######## <-
            bar adjustment adj style 'vscrollbar"
```

Error happened.

I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 41, in script
    $ renpy.ui.interact()
  File "renpy/common/000statements.rpy", line 363, in execute_pause
    renpy.pause()
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 41, in script
    $ renpy.ui.interact()
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\ast.py", line 1635, in execute

    renpy.statements.call(method, parsed, _args, *_kwargs)
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\statements.py", line 144, in call
    return method(parsed, _args, *_kwargs)
  File "renpy/common/000statements.rpy", line 363, in execute_pause
    renpy.pause()
  File "E:\Soft\renpy\renpy\exports.py", line 1125, in pause

This would make it clear if some variable is causing the log to bloat.

data.title: return_stack issue with file location
data.body:
I was playing around with the new functions added in https://github.com/renpy/renpy/commit/a190738a242404e13e12c95019552938a903bc3b  and I realized that if I open a save file from a different location than it was saved in things can go wrong. see this traceback:

```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "renpy/common/00console.rpy", line 608, in script
    return
Exception: Could not find return label (u'E:\\dropbox\\renpy-6.14.1-sdk\\Sunrider Battle alpha/game/shipmap.rpy', 1409525888, 26589).

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "renpy/common/00console.rpy", line 608, in script
    return
  File "D:\renpy\New folder\renpy\ast.py", line 1321, in execute
    next_node(renpy.game.context().lookup_return(pop=True))
  File "D:\renpy\New folder\renpy\execution.py", line 391, in lookup_return
    raise Exception("Could not find return label {!r}.".format(self.return_stack[-1]))
Exception: Could not find return label (u'E:\\dropbox\\renpy-6.14.1-sdk\\Sunrider Battle alpha/game/shipmap.rpy', 1409525888, 26589).

Windows-7-6.1.7601-SP1
Ren'Py 6.18.2.0
Sunrider Mask of Arcadius  Beta 7.0
```

the path inside this 'label' E:\dropbox\renpy-6.14.1-sdk\Sunrider Battle alpha/game/shipmap.rpy'  is NOT the path the game is located that I'm currently running! I actually have a local copy of the game at 'D:\renpy\ new folder\sunrider beta 6' and that's where I'm running the game and trying to load this save. the save file was almost certainly created at that location, however. also, that's the location ren'py has been pointed to as the 'project folder' for some time.

I've tried replicating this with a new test project by changing the 'project folder', making a new project, making a save, moving the test project to inside the renpy folder and running it there. however, it loads fine. the inconsistency of this issue is probably the strangest thing about it.

I don't even understand where this elaborate tuple of (path, int,int) comes from and why it is used instead of a regular string to reference a label. while experimenting I've seen regular strings in the return stack a number of times, so I know that is how usually things work.

data.title: Expose the return stack.
data.body: So games that change in odd ways can check that the return location exists, and fix things up if it does not.

data.title: Add a way to have buttons opt-out of the keyboard focus system.
data.body: Per http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=28531&p=340749#p340749

data.title: New Launcher Bug
data.body:
The latest release features a weird bug. If you have no project selected in the tree and click launch a new launcher appears. I tested on a previous build I had downloaded and it didn't exist.
To reproduce:
1. Select update.
2. Click Proceed.
3. No project should be selected now.
4. Click Launch.

Also, on the second launcher, update doesn't exist. I don't know what causes this. 

Edit: Attempted to reproduce in a new launcher and it wouldn't. It must only appear in the restarted version of Ren'Py when updated. I don't know, sorry.

Edit 2: I looked into it more and it seems to go with the option of "Open Launcher Project". I still don't know what caused this in the first place though.

data.title: Update Spanish template
data.body:
Updated options.rpy (English comments deleted: redundant)
Updated screens.rpy (from the English template, with arguments in the screens definitions)

data.title: Launcher mismatch
data.body:
Hello,

I've tracked down a problem I encounter in various Ren'Py games, especially annoying when it affects games sold through Steam.
So the problem is simple: when I try to launch for example Heileen 1, Bionic Heart or Rising Angels: Reborn (I presume I'd get the same with all the other renpy games on steam that I don't own), it opens the default launcher instead of the game (I mean this screen http://www.renpy.org/doc/html/_images/launcher.png).

For the system specifics, I run archlinux x64 and have renpy installed.

A simple solution is to unset the environmental variable RENPY_BASE (which is set to "/usr/share/renpy/" on my machine), and the games launch correctly, as it don't find my version of renpy anymore.
A fix would be to remove the line 101 "renpy_base = os.environ.get('RENPY_BASE', renpy_base)" in renpy.py. I don't really understand that line anyway: why looking for a (possibly incompatible) version of renpy instead of using the version shipped with the game? As far as I know the shipped version could have been modified for the purpose of the game.

ADD: I just tried to download the demo of http://www.winterwolves.com/planetstronghold.htm and got the same problem.

data.title: minimum size ain't available for viewport?
data.body:
u'xminimum' is not a keyword argument or valid child for the viewport statement.
    xminimum 400

Same for (y)minimum

Since maximum works just fine i guess minimum should too? Anyway documentation says that all positional properties are fine for viewport.... Though who knows since documentation in general isn't very detailed at all

RenPy 6.18
